00048 ## @brief The TreeParser class parses the arch (XML) of tree views.
00049 #
00050 # In order to use this function execute the parse() function with the XML
00051 # data to parse as string.
00052 # This will fill in the title (string), toolbar (boolean) and fieldsOrder 
00053 # (list). 
00054 #
00055 # title contains the 'string' attribute set in the 'tree'
00056 # tag of the XML or 'Tree' if none was specified. The 
00057 # same applies to the toolbar property with the 'toolbar' attribute.
00058 # The fieldsOrder property, is the list of field names specified in the XML
00059 # in the exact same order that appear there.
00060 class TreeParser:
00061         def tagStart(self, name, attrs):
00062                 if name=='tree':
00063                         self.title = attrs.get('string',_('Tree'))
00064                         self.toolbar = bool(attrs.get('toolbar',False))
00065                 elif name=='field':
00066                         if 'icon' in attrs:
00067                                 self.fieldsOrder.append(str(attrs['icon']))
00068                         self.fieldsOrder.append(str(attrs['name']))
00069                 else:
00070                         Debug.error( 'unknown tag: ' + str(name) )
00071 
00072         ## @brief This function parses the xml data provided as parameter.
00073         # This function fills class member properties: title, toolbar and 
00074         # fieldsOrder
00075         def parse(self, xmlData):
00076                 self.fieldsOrder = []
00077 
00078                 psr = expat.ParserCreate()
00079                 psr.StartElementHandler = self.tagStart
00080                 psr.Parse(xmlData.encode('utf-8'))
00081 
00082 (TreeWidgetUi, TreeWidgetBase) = loadUiType( Common.uiPath('tree.ui') )
00083 
00084 ## @brief The TreeWidget class shows main menu tree as well as other tree views.
00085 class TreeWidget( QWidget, TreeWidgetUi ): 
00086         def __init__( self, view, model, domain=None, context=None, name=False, parent=None ):
00087                 QWidget.__init__(self,parent)
00088                 TreeWidgetUi.__init__(self)
00089                 self.setupUi( self )
00090 
00091                 if domain is None:
00092                         domain = []
00093                 if context is None:
00094                         context = {}
00095 
00096                 self.uiSplitter.setStretchFactor( 0, 0 )
00097                 self.uiSplitter.setStretchFactor( 1, 2 )
00098 
00099                 self.context = context
00100                 self.model = view['model']
00101                 if view.get('field_parent', False):
00102                         self.domain = []
00103                 else:
00104                         self.domain = domain
00105                 self.view = view
00106 
00107                 # Next expression sounds absurd but field_parent contains the
00108                 # name of the field that links to the children: 'child_id' for
00109                 # the ir.ui.menu for example
00110                 self.childrenField = self.view['field_parent']
00111 
00112                 self.handlers = {
00113                         'Switch': self.editCurrentItem,
00114                         'Print': self.printCurrent,
00115                         'PrintHtml': self.printHtmlCurrent,
00116                         'Reload': self.reload,
00117                         'StoreViewSettings': self.storeViewState,
00118                 }
00119 
00120                 parser = TreeParser()
00121                 parser.parse( view['arch'] )
00122                 self.toolbar = parser.toolbar
00123 
00124                 # Get all visible fields + parent field description
00125                 self.fields = Rpc.session.execute('/object', 'execute', self.model, 'fields_get', parser.fieldsOrder + [self.childrenField], self.context)
00126 
00127                 self.treeModel = KooModel( self )
00128                 self.treeModel.setFields( self.fields )
00129                 self.treeModel.setFieldsOrder( parser.fieldsOrder )
00130                 self.treeModel.setIconForField( 'icon', 'name')
00131                 self.treeModel.setChildrenForField( self.childrenField, parser.fieldsOrder[0] )
00132                 self.treeModel.setShowBackgroundColor( False )
00133 
00134                 self.listModel = KooModel( self )
00135                 self.listModel.setMode( KooModel.ListMode )
00136                 self.listModel.setFields( self.fields )
00137                 if 'name' in parser.fieldsOrder:
00138                         self.listModel.setFieldsOrder( ['name'] )
00139                 else:
00140                         self.listModel.setFieldsOrder( parser.fieldsOrder )
00141                 self.listModel.setIconForField( 'icon', 'name' )
00142                 self.listModel.setShowBackgroundColor( False )
00143 
00144                 self.group = RecordGroup( self.model, self.fields, context = self.context )
00145                 self.group.setDomain( domain )
00146                 if self.toolbar:
00147                         self.listModel.setRecordGroup( self.group )
00148                 else:
00149                         self.treeModel.setRecordGroup( self.group )
00150 
00151                 self.listModelProxy = QSortFilterProxyModel( self )
00152                 self.listModelProxy.setSourceModel( self.listModel )
00153                 self.listModelProxy.setFilterKeyColumn( 0 )
00154                 self.listModelProxy.setFilterCaseSensitivity( Qt.CaseInsensitive )
00155                 self.listModelProxy.setFilterFixedString( "partner" )
00156 
00157                 self.uiTree.setModel( self.treeModel )
00158                 self.uiList.setModel( self.listModel )
00159 
00160                 self.connect(self.uiTree, SIGNAL('activated( QModelIndex )'), self.open )
00161 
00162                 for column in xrange(len(parser.fieldsOrder)):
00163                         fieldName = parser.fieldsOrder[column]
00164                         delegate = FieldDelegateFactory.create( self.fields[fieldName]['type'], self.uiTree, self.fields[fieldName] )
00165                         self.uiTree.setItemDelegateForColumn( column, delegate )
00166 
00167 
00168                 self.treeAllExpandedState = {}
00169                 self.treeState = {}
00170                 if self.toolbar:
00171                         # Save index states if we're showing uiList widget only, otherwise we don't need it.
00172                         self.connect(self.uiTree,SIGNAL('expanded( QModelIndex )'), self.saveIndexState )
00173                         self.connect(self.uiTree,SIGNAL('collapsed( QModelIndex )'), self.saveIndexState )
00174 
00175                 self.connect(self.pushShortcuts, SIGNAL('clicked()'), self.editShortcuts)
00176                 self.connect(self.pushAddShortcut, SIGNAL('clicked()'), self.addShortcut)
00177                 self.connect(self.pushRemoveShortcut, SIGNAL('clicked()'), self.removeShortcut)
00178                 self.connect(self.pushExpand, SIGNAL('clicked()'), self.expand)
00179                 self.connect(self.uiShortcuts, SIGNAL('activated(QModelIndex)'), self.goToShortcut)
00180                 self.connect(self.uiList.selectionModel(),SIGNAL('currentChanged(QModelIndex, QModelIndex)'),self.mainMenuClicked)
00181 
00182                 if name:
00183                         self.name = name
00184                 else:
00185                         self.name = parser.title
00186                 
00187                 # Shortcuts
00188                 if self.model == 'ir.ui.menu':
00189                         scFields = Rpc.session.execute('/object', 'execute', 'ir.ui.view_sc', 'fields_get', ['res_id', 'name'])
00190                         self.shortcutsGroup = RecordGroup( 'ir.ui.view_sc', scFields, context = self.context )
00191                         self.shortcutsGroup.setDomain( [('user_id','=',Rpc.session.uid), ('resource','=',model)] )
00192                         self.shortcutsModel = KooModel( self )
00193                         self.shortcutsModel.setMode( KooModel.ListMode )
00194                         self.shortcutsModel.setFields( scFields )
00195                         self.shortcutsModel.setFieldsOrder( ['name'] )
00196                         self.shortcutsModel.setRecordGroup( self.shortcutsGroup )
00197                         self.shortcutsModel.setShowBackgroundColor( False )
00198                         self.uiShortcuts.setModel( self.shortcutsModel )
00199                         self.uiShortcutsContainer.show()
00200                 else:
00201                         self.uiShortcutsContainer.hide()
00202                 
00203                 if not parser.toolbar:
00204                         self.uiList.hide()
00205                 else:
00206                         # Highlight the first element of the list and update the tree
00207                         self.uiList.setCurrentIndex( self.uiList.moveCursor( QAbstractItemView.MoveHome, Qt.NoModifier ) )
00208                         self.updateTree()
00209                 self.restoreViewState()
00210 
00211         def saveIndexState(self, index):
00212                 mainKey = self.uiList.currentIndex().row()
00213                 key = ( index.row(), index.column(), index.internalPointer() )
00214                 if not mainKey in self.treeState:
00215                         self.treeState[mainKey] = {}
00216                 self.treeState[mainKey][ key ] = self.uiTree.isExpanded( index )
00217 
00218         def restoreIndexStates(self):
00219                 mainKey = self.uiList.currentIndex().row()
00220                 if not mainKey in self.treeState:
00221                         return
00222                 subtree = self.treeState[ mainKey ]
00223                 for key, value in subtree.iteritems():
00224                         index = self.treeModel.createIndex( key[0], key[1], key[2] )
00225                         self.uiTree.setExpanded( index, value )
00226 
00227         def updateTree(self):
00228                 item = self.uiList.currentIndex()
00229                 if not item.isValid():
00230                         return
00231                 id = item.data( Qt.UserRole ).toInt()[0]
00232                 if not id:
00233                         return
00234                 m = self.group[ id ]
00235                 group = m.value( self.childrenField )
00236                 group.addFields( self.group.fields )
00237                 self.treeModel.setRecordGroup( group )
00238         
00239         def mainMenuClicked( self, currentIndex, previousIndex ):
00240                 if self.toolbar:
00241                         self.treeAllExpandedState[ self.listModel.id( previousIndex ) ] = self.pushExpand.isChecked()
00242                 self.updateTree()
00243                 if self.toolbar:
00244                         self.setAllExpanded( self.treeAllExpandedState.get( self.listModel.id( currentIndex ), False ) )
00245                         self.restoreIndexStates()
00246 
00247         def setAllExpanded(self, value):
00248                 self.pushExpand.setChecked( value )
00249                 if value:
00250                         self.uiTree.expandAll()
00251                         self.pushExpand.setIcon( QIcon( ':/images/up.png' ) )
00252                 else:
00253                         self.uiTree.collapseAll()
00254                         self.pushExpand.setIcon( QIcon( ':/images/down.png' ) )
00255 
00256         def reload(self):
00257                 QApplication.setOverrideCursor( Qt.WaitCursor )
00258                 try:
00259                         self.group.update()
00260                         self.uiList.setCurrentIndex( self.uiList.moveCursor( QAbstractItemView.MoveHome, Qt.NoModifier ) )
00261                         self.treeAllExpandedState = {}
00262                         self.treeState = {}
00263                         self.updateTree()
00264                         # Reload shortcuts and emit the shortcutsChanged
00265                         # signal so 'Window' menu and these shortcuts can be
00266                         # kept in sync.
00267                         if self.model == 'ir.ui.menu':
00268                                 self.shortcutsGroup.update()
00269                                 self.emit( SIGNAL('shortcutsChanged'), self.model )
00270                 except Rpc.RpcException, e:
00271                         pass
00272                 QApplication.restoreOverrideCursor()
00273 
00274         # TODO: Look if for some menu entries this has any sense. Otherwise
00275         # remove both functions. Of course we should connect the actions and
00276         # add them to the handlers dict if they are necessary.
00277         def printCurrent(self):
00278                 self.executeAction(keyword='client_print_multi', report_type='html')
00279 
00280         def printHtmlCurrent(self):
00281                 self.executeAction(keyword='client_print_multi')
00282 
00283         def executeAction(self, keyword='tree_but_action', id=None, report_type='pdf'):
00284                 if id:
00285                         Api.instance.executeKeyword(keyword, {'model':self.model, 'id':id, 'report_type':report_type, 'ids': [id]}, self.context)
00286                 else:
00287                         QMessageBox.information( self, _('Information'), _('No resource selected!'))
00288 
00289         def open(self, idx):
00290                 id = self.treeModel.id( idx )
00291                 if id:
00292                         self.executeAction( 'tree_but_open', id )
00293 
00294         def editCurrentItem(self):
00295                 id = self.treeModel.id( self.uiTree.currentIndex() )
00296                 if id:
00297                         Api.instance.createWindow(None, self.model, id, self.domain)
00298                 else:
00299                         QMessageBox.information(self, _('Information'), _('No resource selected!'))
00300 
00301         def removeShortcut(self):
00302                 id = self.currentShortcutId()
00303                 if not id:
00304                         return
00305                 Rpc.session.execute('/object', 'execute', 'ir.ui.view_sc', 'unlink', [id], self.context)
00306                 self.shortcutsGroup.update()
00307                 self.emit(SIGNAL('shortcutsChanged'), self.model)
00308 
00309         def editShortcuts(self):
00310                 domain = [('user_id', '=', Rpc.session.uid), ('resource', '=', self.model)]
00311                 Api.instance.createWindow(None, 'ir.ui.view_sc', domain=domain, context=self.context, mode='tree,form')
00312 
00313         def addShortcut(self):
00314                 id = self.treeModel.id( self.uiTree.currentIndex() )
00315                 if id == None:
00316                         QMessageBox.information( self, _('No item selected'), _('Please select an element from the tree to add a shortcut to it.') )
00317                         return
00318                 res = Rpc.session.execute('/object', 'execute', self.model, 'name_get', [id], Rpc.session.context)
00319                 for (id,name) in res:
00320                         uid = Rpc.session.uid
00321                         Rpc.session.execute('/object', 'execute', 'ir.ui.view_sc', 'create', {'resource':self.model, 'user_id':uid, 'res_id':id, 'name':name}, self.context)
00322                 self.shortcutsGroup.update()
00323                 self.emit( SIGNAL('shortcutsChanged'), self.model )
00324 
00325         def goToShortcut(self, index):
00326                 id = self.currentShortcutId()
00327                 if not id:
00328                         return
00329                 m = self.shortcutsGroup[ id ]
00330                 # We need to get the value as if we were the server because we
00331                 # don't want the string that would be shown for the many2one field
00332                 # but the id.
00333                 id = self.shortcutsGroup.fieldObjects[ 'res_id' ].get( m )
00334                 if not id:
00335                         return
00336                 self.executeAction('tree_but_open', id)
00337 
00338         def expand(self):
00339                 if self.toolbar:
00340                         # As expandAll() and collapseAll() do not emit 
00341                         # a signal for each item, remove all states stored
00342                         # for this list index.
00343                         mainKey = self.uiList.currentIndex().row()
00344                         if mainKey in self.treeState:
00345                                 del self.treeState[ mainKey ]
00346                 if self.pushExpand.isChecked():
00347                         self.uiTree.expandAll()
00348                         self.pushExpand.setIcon( QIcon( ':/images/up.png' ) )
00349                 else:
00350                         self.uiTree.collapseAll()
00351                         self.pushExpand.setIcon( QIcon( ':/images/down.png' ) )
00352 
00353         def currentShortcutId(self):
00354                 item = self.uiShortcuts.currentIndex()
00355                 if not item.isValid():
00356                         return None
00357                 id = item.data( Qt.UserRole ).toInt()[0]
00358                 return id
00359 
00360         # There's no reason why a menu can't be closed, is it?
00361         def canClose(self):
00362                 self.storeViewState()
00363                 return True
00364         
00365         def storeViewState(self):
00366                 id = self.view['view_id']
00367                 if not id:
00368                         return
00369                 header = self.uiTree.header()
00370                 ViewSettings.store( id, str( header.saveState().toBase64() ) )
00371                 
00372         def restoreViewState(self):
00373                 id = self.view['view_id']
00374                 if not id:
00375                         return
00376                 settings = ViewSettings.load( id )
00377                 if not settings:
00378                         return
00379                 header = self.uiTree.header()
00380                 header.restoreState( QByteArray.fromBase64( settings ) )
00381                 
00382         def actions(self):
00383                 return []
00384 
00385         def switchViewMenu(self):
00386                 return None
